ce188439ce5ceba476e6160e43959975.paragraph: The Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, commonly referred to as the Russian Armed Forces, are the military of Russia. They are the world's fifth-largest military force in terms of active-duty personnel, with 1.15 million and at least two million reserve personnel. Russia plans to expand its active personnel force to 1.5 million by 2026. The country has three primary branches of service: the Ground Forces, the Navy, and the Aerospace Forces, as well as two independent arms of service: the Strategic Rocket Forces and Airborne Forces. In addition, the Special Operations Forces Command was established in 2013. Russia had the world's third-highest military expenditure in 2023, allocating a budget of approximately US$86.4 billion to the military. The Russian Armed Forces maintain the world's largest stockpile of nuclear weapons and possess the world's second-largest fleet of ballistic missile submarines. They are also one of only three national militaries that operate strategic bombers. Male citizens aged 18–27 are mandated to serve one year of military service in Russia.
ce188439ce5ceba476e6160e43959975.summary: The Russian Armed Forces, with approximately 1.15 million active-duty personnel, are the fifth-largest military force in the world. Russia plans to expand its active personnel force to 1.5 million by 2026. It has three primary branches of service, namely the Ground Forces, Navy, and Aerospace Forces, and two independent arms of service, the Strategic Rocket Forces and Airborne Forces. Russia has the third-highest military expenditure and maintains the largest stockpile of nuclear weapons. Male citizens aged 18–27 are obligated to serve one year of military service.
